intro: Hoya bifunda, commonly known as the "Wax Plant" or "Porcelain Flower," is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Thailand and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Hoya bifunda is a climbing plant that often grows on trees or rocks, using its aerial roots for support. It is popular among indoor gardeners due to its ease of care and attractive appearance.
